availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Orson Martin Tribble (Madison County, KY, farmer and soldier)

body.p: Madison County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Madison County native. Married to Nancy M. Bush Tribble in Madison County on November 22, 1859. Father of Jennie Tribble, William Tribble, John Tribble, and Charles Tribble. Farmer in Madison County in 1860. Signed letter to Governor Beriah Magoffin on March 11, 1861 stating intention to serve in a militia company from Richmond, Kentucky.

ab.bibl:
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, X County Marriages, Film #000183317, p. 171 and Film # 000183302, p. 213.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Madison County, Division 1, pp. 313-14
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, County, Elliston District, p. 90B
Find A Grave, "Orson Martin “O.M.” Tribble (1828-1910)," Memorial #115304199, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/115304199 (accessed September 13, 2019).
